data.title: Pretty Good
data.text: We visited here for our first time and I give a thumbs up. Went there for late lunch/early dinner. Service is good, food pretty tasty and decent portions for the price. Fairly diverse menu, BUT don't expect to be able to talk with members of your party. Very loud, but everyone seemed to be having a good time. That's the only retraction we could find.

data.title: Fun spot in town!
data.text:
I reserved a table for 11....they had it redy in front of fireplace when we arrived!
Terrific lunch choices for some comfort warm food after being outside walking at Pyramid Hill!!

data.title: A great neighborhood Tavern
data.text: In addition to a full bar, Ryan's has a great menu and features specials daily. We have eaten there many times and will do so many more. The interior decor is that of an Irish pub and features some beautiful woodwork. I think this is Hamilton's best local restaurant.

data.title: Good old tavern
data.text: We have often visited Ryan's Tavern.  The atmosphere is great, dark wood, tall booths and  a large old fashion bar with a fireplace on the far wall.  The food is decent.  I love the hot brown and shepherd's pie.  The prices are good and service friendly.

data.title: Wedding Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: We had a very small wedding rehearsal dinner - 10 total.  We booked the back corner of Ryans a couple of months in advance. When we arrived, we were surprised to find out that it was Witches Night Out in Hamilton.  The servers were dressed as witches and warlocks and they had a special menu for the event. This made the dinner even more fun and unique.  I was thrilled to show our guests how much fun Hamilton is!  The food received rave reviews from all in attendance. It was a rehearsal dinner unlike any other!  Thanks Ryans.

data.title: Just Okay
data.text: I had dinner here with two fellow businessmen.  The menu was standard pub fare.  I opted for tavern salad and soup.  There was nothing special about the food and the service was mediocre.  .

data.title: Mediocre food at best
data.text: Been here 3 times - Tried the Shepherd's Pie, Fish n chips, and a sandwich.  Skip Ryan's and head to West Chester to the Dinglehouse - better food and outdoor area.  Now I only go when friends go since it's close to Municipal Brewworks...

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: My husband and I have tried this place more than once and just do not care for it.  Menu needs more selection.  Food just okay.  Service could be better.  We have been disappointed every time.  Probably will not return.

data.title: The cooks must have changed
data.text: I have been to Ryan's many times.  I stopped there for a late lunch or early dinner this week.  I ordered the meatloaf. a dish I have had there many times.  I was surprised that the serving was about half of what it has been in the past.  I also think that the recipe has been drastically altered.  I was disappointed and mentioned the serving size to the server.  She seem to not know.  Maybe she was new.  She did bring me more meatloaf.  The service was fine and we enjoyed ourselves.  Reducing the serving size may have been a way to not increase the price?  I guess I was disappointed because we drove several miles out of our way to have the meatloaf.

data.title: Nice Atmosphere
data.text: Food average, atmosphere GREAT.  Beautiful Irish pub with lovely decor located in the heart of downtown Hamilton. Menu selection is disappointing. Wish they had better food. Service slow on our week night visit, but we didn't mind as we were out with friends for conversation. Waitress was unacquainted with beer choices and was unable to make good recommendations....resulting in my curious friend getting stuck with an awful jalapeño lime beer. EW.  Three stars for potential and atmosphere. Maybe it was just a bad night. We will likely give them another chance.

data.title: So Very Excellent
data.text: We  ventured out on the 127 garage sale extravaganza. We had the most fun and Kentucky and when we went to Ryan's Tavern or what a wonderful experience we had there. By using trip advisor we  noted they had the best fish and chips.  it was fantastic the service was great it was just a great place to stop

data.title: Rehearsal dinner in Nov. 2015
data.text: My husband and I had our rehearsal dinner here. We met with the owner before the dinner and went over the dining options. Mr. Ryan is an extremely nice person and was genuine about providing us with a positive experience at his restaurant. He allowed us to choose the menu for our guests and everything went exactly as we had planned and discussed.The food was great. The meatloaf and fish and chips are delicious. They also have bacon bleu cheese fries that are absolutely amazing. The building had a great Irish pub feel to it and it's very clean and neat on the inside and outside. We loved it here.

data.title: Walking distance from courtyard
data.text: Nice selection of draft beers.. Old school chicken salad sliders were great. It was a five minute walk from the Marriott courtyard

data.title: THE BEST FOOD
data.text: Thye were very fast with getting my food... the food was excellent better than applebees and fridays

data.title: Best in Hamilton
data.text: One of the best sit down restaurants in Hamilton, right in the middle of downtown. Beautiful Irish tavern.

data.title: A fun pub --
data.text: Visiting family in Hamilton, we stopped by Ryan's one night for a late-ish dinner.  We had good beer and I ordered the Guinness shrimp, which was excellent.  I'm not a fan of the high-style chairs, but they were comfortable.  The waitress was excellent.  A nice evening.

data.title: An Irish Pub
data.text: The restaurant is located on the main street of Hamilton. The restaurant has an Irish pub theme. The service was good. I had the meat loaf. It was too dense. My brother had a Rueben Sandwich which was good.

data.title: Nice atmosphere and service was good.
data.text: Met friends to have dinner.  We had good service and the meat loaf was good and the serving was huge.  I have had the meatloaf several times as well as the fish.  The food had always been tasty.  Service is normally good but there have been lapses in the quality of service at times.

data.title: Business Lunch
data.text: Great service and great food!  The atmosphere and décor creates a great ambience that adds to a meeting as well as any personal gathering.

data.title: Fun stop!
data.text:
We went here for dinner based on previous reviews.  The building is beautiful, and fits the tavern.  Good service, and many choices on the menu.

We would definately return!
